description:
The Eurovision Song Contest is an international songwriting competition organised annually by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), featuring participants representing primarily European countries. Each participating country submits an original song to be performed on live television and radio, transmitted to national broadcasters via the EBU's Eurovision and Euroradio networks, with competing countries then casting votes for the other countries' songs to determine a winner.

The Eurovision Song Contest 2022 is the upcoming 66th edition of the Eurovision. The contest will consist of two semi-finals on May 10 and May 12, and a final on May 14, 2022. Forty countries will take part in the contest.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Ukraine is announced the winner of The Eurovision Song Contest 2022, and "No" otherwise. If for any reason, the winner of the contest is not decided by May 21, 2022 (11:59:59 PM ET), this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is the official channel of the ESC, https://eurovision.tv/.

events.title: Will Ukraine win the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest?
